PAD_SeenScryingEye.synopsis: Party notices a scrying eye floating around Grymforge. They might recognise it from having seen the eye in the goblin camp.

PAD_FoundAdamantine.synopsis: Player comments on some slag they just found while exploring the forge area. They notice a glimmer, and might be able to identify it as Adamantine.
PAD_FoundAdamantine.how_to_trigger: Collect some Adamantine in Ketheric City

PAD_NereDiedDeserted.synopsis: While on a quest for getting Nere's head, the party comments on returning to the grymforge where Nere was trapped behind the rubble, and finding out that it is too late to save Nere - he's dead and all the duergar and gnomes have left. Cave-in is already cleared
PAD_NereDiedDeserted.how_to_trigger: - goto -631; 14; 310- talk to Nere- take long rest

PAD_DeadScryingEye.synopsis: PAD when you loot the dead scrying eye in the Duergar camp.

PAD_Plaque_02.synopsis: Player clicks on plaque in front of statue in Grymforge. They get the second half of a famous poem about Shar and Selune.

Entrance_VB_1P.synopsis: VB for when the players arrive at the Duergar camp (which used to be a fort built by Ketheric).

PAD_TheHangingBridge.synopsis: PAD when the player sees bodies of dead drow hanging from the bridge in Ketheric city.

Entrance_VB_2P.synopsis: VB for when the players arrive at the Duergar camp (which used to be a fort built by Ketheric).

PAD_Plaque_01.synopsis: Player clicks on plaque in front of statue in Grymforge. They get the first half of a famous poem about Shar and Selune.

PAD_HarperPin.synopsis: Party interacts with a drow corpse in a cage, and loot a pin off it. If they pass a history check, they recognise the pin as having a harper symbol.
PAD_HarperPin.how_to_trigger: Loot the pin from a dead drow in a hanging cage.

PAD_SawRustyWeapons.synopsis: Player characters comment on the rusty weapons found in Ketheric City - meant to establish how long it's been since Grymforge was occupied.
PAD_SawRustyWeapons.how_to_trigger: Approach the rusty weapons for the first time at any of these locations:-604; 18; 402-639; 22; 459-653; 27; 430-603; 22; 462-610; 19; 393-583; 20; 302-647; 19; 379

PAD_SharLift.synopsis: Players jump on the fake elevator to the shar temple. It doesn't work from the side of the ketheric city. Only for one character because it's not guaranteed another will be able to reach the elevator also.
PAD_SharLift.how_to_trigger: Jump to the elevator to the shar temple at -686; 10; 255 (It's nigh imppossible).

PAD_SeenScryingEye_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SeenScryingEye_0.text: Another scrying eye, same as the goblins had. Someone's watching.

PAD_SeenScryingEye_3.speaker: Player
PAD_SeenScryingEye_3.text: Best to stay out of its way.

PAD_SeenScryingEye_1.speaker: Player
PAD_SeenScryingEye_1.text: A scrying eye. Wonder who's looking through it.

PAD_SeenScryingEye_2.speaker: Player
PAD_SeenScryingEye_2.text: That orb - it's a scrying eye. Someone's watching.

PAD_SeenScryingEye_4.speaker: Player
PAD_SeenScryingEye_4.text: Another scrying eye. Best to keep my distance.

PAD_FoundAdamantine_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundAdamantine_0.text: Are those... specks of adamantine in this slag?

PAD_FoundAdamantine_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundAdamantine_1.text: Not much use for this slag. Nice speckles, though.

PAD_NereDiedDeserted_0.speaker: Player
PAD_NereDiedDeserted_0.text: The slavers are gone - Nere must be dead by now. Just need to grab his head.
PAD_NereDiedDeserted_0.context: InternalNodeContext: "It looks like they left, leaving Nere to a slow, painful death. Anyway, we still need his head for the myconids."

PAD_DeadScryingEye_0.speaker: Player
PAD_DeadScryingEye_0.text: A scrying eye - or whatever's left of it.
PAD_DeadScryingEye_0.context: NodeContext: Gale says this tongue-in-cheek. It's not a true request: the scrying eye is dead.

PAD_Plaque_02_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Plaque_02_0.text: *Selûne did call forth the moon and the stars; Shar cloaked them in shadow to cover our scars.*

Entrance_VB_1P_0.speaker: Player
Entrance_VB_1P_0.text: What's a fort like this doing in the Underdark?

PAD_TheHangingBridge_0.speaker: Player
PAD_TheHangingBridge_0.text: Dead drow, publicly displayed. The duergar are sending a message.

Entrance_VB_2P_1.speaker: Player
Entrance_VB_2P_1.text: What's a fort like this doing in the Underdark?

Entrance_VB_2P_0.speaker: Player
Entrance_VB_2P_0.text: Whoever built it, they've let it rot for ages.

PAD_Plaque_01_0.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Plaque_01_0.text: *In the beginning came morning, then night; two sisters clashed - one dark and one light.*

PAD_HarperPin_0.speaker: Player
PAD_HarperPin_0.text: What an odd emblem. Don't think I've seen it before.

PAD_HarperPin_1.speaker: Player
PAD_HarperPin_1.text: This is a Harper emblem. What was she doing here?

PAD_SawRustyWeapons_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SawRustyWeapons_0.text: Half rust - whoever owned those weapons has been gone for some time.

PAD_SharLift_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SharLift_0.text: That's it, then. I can't jump any further.
